sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: DIH Holdings CEO and Director Jason Chen Fully Departs
feed.summary: Jason Chen has fully departed from DIH Holdings US, Inc. (DHAI), resigning as CEO on November 24, 2025, from all subsidiary roles on November 25, 2025, and from the board and its committees by December 15, 2025. The company faces significant financial challenges, including negative profitability and Nasdaq delisting concerns, leading TipRanks' AI Analyst Spark to rate DHAI as an "Underperform" with a "Sell" price target of $0.03.

feed.title: DIH Holdings Faces Nasdaq Delisting and Trading Suspension
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. (DHAI) faces delisting from Nasdaq and suspension of trading on November 7, 2025, due to Nasdaq denying its request to continue listing. The company does not plan to appeal and will suspend operations because of the delisting and inability to secure additional capital. Shares will be traded over-the-counter, potentially impacting their price and liquidity.

feed.title: DIH Holding US, Inc. Reports Fiscal 2025 Fourth Quarter and Year-End Financial Results
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. announced its financial results for the fiscal 2025 fourth quarter and year ended March 31, 2025, reporting a slight revenue decrease to $62.9 million for the year and a significant 34.7% revenue decline in the fourth quarter. The company faced challenges including lower sales volume, increased operating expenses, and impairment losses, but also initiated strategic moves like a reverse stock split and a new equity line of credit to stabilize and grow its business. Chairman and CEO Jason Chen expressed commitment to innovation and long-term success despite the mixed performance.

feed.title: DIH HOLDING US, INC. SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. has released its annual Form 10-K report, detailing a 2.5% revenue decrease to $62.9 million but an 8.2% gross profit increase to $32.2 million. The company reported significant operating and net losses, and faces challenges including financial viability concerns, geopolitical risks, and regulatory compliance. DIH plans strategic initiatives like continued innovation, selective acquisitions, and seeking additional funding to address liquidity constraints.

feed.title: DIH Holding US enters agreement for up to $22 million private share sale
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. (NASDAQ:DHAI) has announced a common shares purchase agreement to sell up to $22 million or 10,458,031 shares to an investor via private placement, aiming to address significant financial pressures including a 90% year-to-date stock drop and potential delisting from Nasdaq. The company plans to use the net proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes, while also appealing Nasdaq's delisting notices and making strategic board appointments.

feed.title: DIH Holdings US Implements Reverse Stock Split - TipRanks
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. executed a one-for-twenty-five reverse stock split of its Class A common stock on October 17, 2025, aiming to consolidate shares without altering ownership percentages. The company, which specializes in robotic devices for physical rehabilitation, faces challenges including negative profitability and equity, and unattractive valuation metrics, leading TipRanks' AI Analyst Spark to rate DHAI as Neutral.

feed.title: DIH Holding US, Inc. Announces 1-for-25 Reverse Stock Split Effective October 20, 2025 - Quiver Quantitative
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. announced a 1-for-25 reverse stock split of its Class A Common Stock, effective October 20, 2025, a measure approved by stockholders to reduce outstanding shares from approximately 52 million to 2 million. This split aims to enhance the stock's market value without significantly altering stockholders' percentage ownership or voting power. The company, focused on advanced rehabilitation technology, anticipates this move may attract more institutional investors.

feed.title: Dih Holding US, Inc. announces reverse stock split of its Series A common stock - MarketScreener
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. announced a reverse stock split of its Series A common stock. This news follows a recent notice from Nasdaq regarding an additional basis for delisting in September, highlighting the company's efforts to address its stock performance. The article mentions recent board appointments and financial reports, including revenue guidance for fiscal year 2025.

feed.title: DIH Holding US, Inc. Announces Reverse Stock Split of its Series A Common Stock - GlobeNewswire
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. announced a 1-for-25 reverse stock split of its Class A Common Stock, effective October 20, 2025, to be traded under its existing Nasdaq symbol DHAI. The split was approved by stockholders and the Board of Directors, resulting in approximately 2,092,652 shares outstanding after the split. No fractional shares will be issued, and stockholder percentage ownership will remain largely unchanged.

feed.title: DIH Holdings US Enters $22M Stock Purchase Agreement
feed.summary: DIH Holdings US, Inc. has entered into an agreement to sell up to $22 million in Class A common stock to an investor, representing 19.99% of the company’s voting power. The proceeds are intended for working capital and general purposes, with a resale registration statement to be filed. TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, has given DHAI a Neutral rating, citing challenges with profitability, equity, and corporate governance concerns.

feed.title: DIH Holding US faces Nasdaq delisting review after continued non-compliance
feed.summary: DIH Holding US is facing a Nasdaq delisting review due to continued non-compliance with several listing rules, including minimum market value of publicly held shares, market value of listed securities, and bid price requirements. The company has appealed to the Nasdaq Hearings Panel and is attempting to regain compliance while also dealing with unfiled financial reports. Despite challenges, DIH Holding US maintains annual revenue of $69.57 million and has

feed.title: DIH Holding US, Inc. Receives Additional Nasdaq Staff Determination Letter
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. (NASDAQ:DHAI) received an additional Nasdaq delisting notice on September 12, 2025, for failing to regain compliance with the Bid Price Rule. The company had previously received a notice on March 11, 2025, and did not meet the September 8, 2025, compliance deadline. DIH has requested a hearing before the Nasdaq Hearing Panel to appeal the delisting and present its plan to regain compliance, seeking an extension of time.

feed.title: DIH Holdings Faces Nasdaq Delisting Threat
feed.summary: DIH Holdings US, Inc. (DHAI) faces delisting from Nasdaq after failing to meet the market value requirement by the September 1, 2025 deadline. The company received notice on September 2, 2025, and plans to request a hearing to present a compliance plan and seek an extension, although there's no guarantee of a favorable outcome. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates DHAI as Neutral due to negative profitability, equity, bearish technical indicators, and unattractive valuation metrics.

feed.title: DIH Holding US, Inc. Receives Notification of Deficiency from Nasdaq Related to Delayed Filing of Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. (NASDAQ:DHAI) announces it received a notification from Nasdaq for non-compliance due to the delayed filing of its Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for June 30, 2025, and its Annual Report on Form 10-K for March 31, 2025. The company has until September 29, 2025, to submit a compliance plan, with a possibility of up to 180 days from the 10-K due date to regain compliance. DIH is actively working with auditors to file the delinquent reports and states the notice has no immediate impact on its stock listing or trading.

feed.title: DIH Holding US, Inc. Completes Public Offering of 5.9 Million Units, Raising Approximately $4.6 Million
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. has successfully completed a public offering of 5,937,100 units at $0.7832 per unit, raising approximately $4.6 million. Each unit includes one share of Class A common stock and a Class A warrant. The proceeds will be used for capital expenditures, working capital, and general corporate purposes, aiding DIH's mission to provide advanced robotic rehabilitation devices.

feed.title: DIH Announces Closing of $4.6 Million Public Offering
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. (NASDAQ: DHAI) has announced the closing of a public offering, raising approximately $4.6 million in gross proceeds. The offering involved 5,937,100 units, each comprising one share of Class A common stock and one Class A warrant, priced at $0.7832 per unit. The company plans to utilize the net proceeds for capital expenditures, working capital, and general corporate purposes.

feed.title: DIH Raises Fresh Capital: $4.6M Offering Unlocks Growth Potential with Strategic Warrant Structure
feed.summary: DIH Holding US (NASDAQ: DHAI) has successfully closed a public offering, raising $4.6 million in gross proceeds through the sale of 5,937,100 units at $0.7832 per unit. Each unit included one share of Class A common stock and a Class A warrant exercisable at the same price for five years. The company plans to use the net proceeds for capital expenditures, working capital, and general corporate purposes, with Maxim Group serving as the sole placement agent.

feed.title: DIH Appoints Shepherd Center as a DIH Center of Excellence
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. (DIH) has appointed Shepherd Center as a DIH Center of Excellence, partnering to enhance rehabilitation outcomes and advance rehabilitation technologies. Shepherd Center is recognized for its expertise in neurorehabilitation and uses DIH's advanced robotic devices for patient therapy. This collaboration aims to drive innovation and improve patient recovery in the field of neurorehabilitation.

feed.title: DIH Announces Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results and Restates June 30, 2024 Form 10-Q
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. announced its financial results for the second fiscal quarter ended September 30, 2024, reporting revenue growth of 39% to $18.2 million and positive income before taxes. The company also restated its first fiscal quarter ended June 30, 2024, financial results to correct timing of revenue recognition for two device sales, adjusting first-quarter revenue to $17.0 million. For fiscal year 2025, DIH has adjusted its revenue guidance to range between $60 million and $67 million.

feed.title: DIH Announces Formation and Inaugural Meeting of Scientific Advisory Board
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. (NASDAQ:DHAI) announced the formation of its Scientific Advisory Board (SAB), comprising leading scientists and clinicians in rehabilitation technology. The SAB will advise DIH on technical and scientific pursuits, product development, and research plans, aiming to enhance rehabilitation solutions for patients with walking impairments, reduced balance, and impaired arm/hand functions. The initial meeting, held in Switzerland, highlighted the collective expertise of the board members, which DIH expects to be vital for its continuous development.

feed.title: ДИХ Announces Fiscal 2024 Fourth Quarter and Fiscal Year End Financial Results
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. announced its financial results for the fiscal 2024 fourth quarter and year ended March 31, 2024, reporting a 19% revenue growth to $64.5 million for the full fiscal year and positive operating cash flow of $5.2 million. The company also detailed a strategic partnership with B. Temia and provided a fiscal year 2025 revenue outlook ranging between $74 million and $77 million. DIH highlighted its critical inflection year, marked by significant commercial growth and a successful initial public offering, reinforcing its commitment to consolidating the fragmented rehabilitation industry.

feed.title: DIH Announces $1.5 million Private Placement Financing from OrbiMed
feed.summary: DIH Holding US, Inc. announced a $1.5 million private placement of common stock from existing shareholder OrbiMed. This financing involved the sale of 150,000 shares at $10 each, plus warrants for an additional 300,000 shares with a $10 exercise price. The funds will be used to expand DIH's global commercial strategy and growth initiatives.

feed.title: Aurora Technology Acquisition Overcomes Nasdaq Challenge, Completes DIH Deal
feed.summary: Aurora Technology Acquisition successfully completed its merger with DIH Holding US despite facing a Nasdaq delisting notice for not meeting market cap requirements. The SPAC obtained Nasdaq approval to list the combined company and its warrants, overcoming the regulatory hurdle just before its deadline. The deal, which involved significant share redemptions, officially closed, with trading set to commence the following day under the new ticker symbol DHAI.
